instance.context:
Maris is in_line for a big raise . Arnold_Palmer and Sam_Snead will be among those honored at the national awards dinner of the Metropolitan_Golf_Writers_Association tonight . The dinner will be held at the Hotel_Pierre . Palmer , golf 's leading money winner in 1960 , and Snead will be saluted as the winning team in the Canada_Cup
matches last June in Dublin . Deane_Beman , the National_Amateur champion , and all the metropolitan district champions , including Bob_Gardner , the amateur title-holder , also will receive awards . The writers ' Gold_Tee_Award will go to John_McAuliffe of Plainfield , N._J. , and Palm_Beach , Fla. , for his sponsorship of charity tournaments . Horton_Smith of Detroit , a former president of the Professional_Golfers_Association , will receive the Ben_Hogan_Trophy for his comeback following a recent illness .

the score in a bowling
match ;

a score that makes the
match even ;

a practical_joke that involves inserting a
match surreptitiously between the sole and upper of the victim's shoe and then lighting it ;

a stick about a meter long with a point on one end ( to stick in the ground ) and a forked head on the other end ( to hold a lighted
match ) ; formerly used to fire cannons ;

when a
match is found an entry is made in the notebook ;

that tie makes a good
match with your jacket ;

a minor
match preceding the main event ;

a
match between boxers ; usually held in a boxing_ring ;

a
match between chess_players ;

a
match in a cockpit between two fighting_cocks heeled with metal gaffs ;

a
match between two cricket teams ;

the final
match between the winners of all previous matches in an elimination_tournament ;

the final match between the winners of all previous
matches in an elimination_tournament ;

the final
match of any cup competition ( such as the annual final of the English soccer competition at Wembley ) ;

a

an international championship
match ;

a

an association of sports teams that organizes

the score needed to win a

the final point needed to win a

one of six divisions into which a polo
